info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 12:27PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Mecklenburg County through 115 PM EDT... At 1227 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Uptown Charlotte, or near Hidden Valley, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Uptown Charlotte, Central Charlotte, East Charlotte, Northwest Charlotte, Mint Hill, Freedom Park, University City, Reedy Creek Park, The Plaza and Hidden Valley. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EDT for the Piedmont of North Carolina.
